``` ::: ::: ::: ### Gradients and backward pass ::: {#81f3a58e .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} from sympy import symbols,diff x,y = symbols('x y') diff(x**2, x) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display .cell-output-markdown execution_count=19} $\displaystyle 2 x$ ::: ::: ::: {#9f8c4f21 .cell execution_count=20} ``` {.python .cell-code} diff(3*x**2+9, x) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display .cell-output-markdown execution_count=20} $\displaystyle 6 x$ ::: ::: ::: {#946fd05c .cell execution_count=21} ``` {.python .cell-code} def lin_grad(inp, out, w, b): # grad of matmul with respect to input inp.g = out.g @ w.t() w.g = (inp.unsqueeze(-1) * out.g.unsqueeze(1)).sum(0) b.g = out.g.sum(0) ``` ::: ::: {#d8244af8 .cell execution_count=22} ``` {.python .cell-code} def forward_and_backward(inp, targ): # forward pass: l1 = lin(inp, w1, b1) l2 = relu(l1) out = lin(l2, w2, b2) diff = out[:,0]-targ loss = diff.pow(2).mean() # backward pass: out.g = 2.*diff[:,None] / inp.shape[0] lin_grad(l2, out, w2, b2) l1.g = (l1>0).float() * l2.g lin_grad(inp, l1, w1, b1) ``` ::: ::: {#6c353f78 .cell execution_count=23} ``` {.python .cell-code} forward_and_backward(x_train, y_train) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ## Refactor model ### Layers as classes ::: {#895d54c8 .cell execution_count=29} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Relu(): def __call__(self, inp): self.inp = inp self.out = inp.clamp_min(0.) return self.out def backward(self): self.inp.g = (self.inp>0).float() * self.out.g ``` ::: ::: {#a1e353dc .cell execution_count=30} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Lin(): def __init__(self, w, b): self.w,self.b = w,b def __call__(self, inp): self.inp = inp self.out = lin(inp, self.w, self.b) return self.out def backward(self): self.inp.g = self.out.g @ self.w.t() self.w.g = self.inp.t() @ self.out.g self.b.g = self.out.g.sum(0) ``` ::: ::: {#3353a1c6 .cell execution_count=31} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Mse(): def __call__(self, inp, targ): self.inp,self.targ = inp,targ self.out = mse(inp, targ) return self.out def backward(self): self.inp.g = 2. * (self.inp.squeeze() - self.targ).unsqueeze(-1) / self.targ.shape[0] ``` ::: ::: {#767d7061 .cell execution_count=32} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Model(): def __init__(self, w1, b1, w2, b2): self.layers = [Lin(w1,b1), Relu(), Lin(w2,b2)] self.loss = Mse() def __call__(self, x, targ): for l in self.layers: x = l(x) return self.loss(x, targ) def backward(self): self.loss.backward() for l in reversed(self.layers): l.backward() ``` ::: ::: {#cbf0c0cf .cell execution_count=33} ``` {.python .cell-code} model = Model(w1, b1, w2, b2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}
